main event: A round, bright object was observed flying behind a mountain in Congers, New York, on December 5, 1953.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for about 30 seconds,The object was observed through the window of a house,There was no sound associated with the sighting,The witness was uncertain enough to conclude that there was insufficient data for evaluation,The report suggests that the object was likely unidentified.
witness description: The witness observed the object from the window of their house and was considered reliable.
